The requirements for steady flow within a control volume For steady-flow, conditions within the control volume are not, on average, changing so that the mass, momentum, energy and entropy within the control volume remain constant. Conservation of mass applied to a control volume - the Continuity Equation In general, this may be written in vector form as 0=+  • cscv dAVdV dt d  where dA is positive out of the control volume.
